meanings.definition: The central or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: The core of the issue was finding a solution.
meanings.sent2: The core of a tree provides strength and support.
meanings.sent3: She realized the core of the problem was miscommunication.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was at the core of his personality.
meanings.sent5: The core of the story revealed the hidden truth.

meanings.definition: The tough central part of various fruits, containing the seeds.
meanings.sent1: She bit into the apple, reaching the core with the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The core of the watermelon was juicy and sweet.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally swallowed an apple core while eating quickly.
meanings.sent4: The core of the peach held the promise of new growth.
meanings.sent5: The core of the orange burst with citrus flavor.

meanings.definition: To remove the tough central part of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cored the apple before slicing it.
meanings.sent2: He always cores his apples before making pie.
meanings.sent3: The chef cored the pineapple with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: Coring the pear made it easier to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: They decided to core the mango for a refreshing snack.
